definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: The traitor was captured trying to escape from the country.
sentences.chinese: 那個賣國賊在企圖逃離這個國家時被逮捕。

sentences.english: If you're buying Chinese crap at Wal-Mart you are being unpatriotic.
sentences.chinese: 你要是去沃爾瑪買東西，你就是賣國賊。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

sentences.english: The traitor in strait straight forwardly told me the traits of the bait.
sentences.chinese: 海峽裏的賣國賊直接主動地告訴了我餌的特性。

sentences.english: Apparently, the White House thinks that the Foreign Office is full of pinkos and traitors.
sentences.chinese: 白宮認爲外交部都是些左傾份子和賣國賊。

sentences.english: If you were in his shoes, what could you do?
sentences.chinese: 都說李鴻章賣國，可他又有什麼能耐呢？

sentences.english: The traitor deserves ill of his country.
sentences.chinese: 賣國賊應受國家的懲罰。

sentences.english: I have cherished meeting these selfless patriots and their families.
sentences.chinese: 我特別珍惜美國不妨具有這些無私的賣國者及其家庭。

sentences.english: How to process these separatist monks of the Dalai Clique.
sentences.chinese: 達賴集團的惡僧賣國賊該當何罪？

sentences.english: From then on he was branded as traitor.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後他被加上賣國賊的污名。

sentences.english: The latter are truly traitors as are the politicians on the USA that helped this.
sentences.chinese: 後者和幫助他們的美國政客一樣，都是真正的賣國賊。

sentences.english: Whoever will betray his country to the enemy will be condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 不論誰賣國投敵將會被判死刑。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

sentences.english: Does Langping guidance USA female vollyball, that is quislism?
sentences.chinese: 郎平執教美國女排，是在“賣國”？

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
